intro: Petalostemon gattingeri, commonly known as the Gattinger's petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
